Be Concrete When Experissing Ideas

Captions from The Elements of Style

####15. Put statements in positive form. … Consciously or unconsciously, the reader is dissatisfied with being told only what is not; the reader wishes to be told what is.

####16. Use definite, specific, concrete language. … If those who have studied the art of writing are in accord on any one point, it is this: the surest way to arouse and hold the reader’s attention is by being specific, definite, and concrete.
